title: Error reading the config.yaml file in frame_extraction.py
body:
Windows 10 Home with an Anaconda Env and DeepLabCut 2.0.5 using Jupyter Notebook to run code. 

In attempting to run the [notebook concerning ones own data](https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut/blob/master/examples/Demo_yourowndata.ipynb) I came across a number of issues. Firstly `yaml.load` without the use of a loader function has depreciated and requires to be replaced by one of the loaders detailed [here](https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/wiki/PyYAML-yaml.load(input)-Deprecation). I have already made the edits to solve this issue. However, the `cfg` variable does not load correctly. While it does produce a dictionary,  all the keys are incorrect. 

Specifically, the following dictionary is produced 
```
['__class__', '__contains__', '__delattr__', '__delitem__', '__dir__', '__doc__', '__eq__', '__format__', '__ge__', '__getattribute__', '__getitem__', '__gt__', '__hash__', '__init__', '__init_subclass__', '__iter__', '__le__', '__len__', '__lt__', '__ne__', '__new__', '__reduce__', '__reduce_ex__', '__repr__', '__setattr__', '__setitem__', '__sizeof__', '__str__', '__subclasshook__', 'clear', 'copy', 'fromkeys', 'get', 'items', 'keys', 'pop', 'popitem', 'setdefault', 'update', 'values']
````

instead of the dictionary that one would expect form the `config.yaml` file. 

The following error is also produced:

```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-4a24d99ed957> in <module>()
      5 path_config_file = "C:\\Users\\jcdea\\OneDrive\\Bath\\Animal_Pose_Estimation\\DeepLab_trial\\Reaching-Jake-2019-03-12\\config.yaml"
      6 #print(path_config_file)
----> 7 deeplabcut.extract_frames(path_config_file,'automatic','uniform',crop=True)
      8 
      9 #there are other ways to grab frames, such as by clustering 'kmeans'; please see the paper.

C:\Users\jcdea\Anaconda3\envs\dlc\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\frame_extraction.py in extract_frames(config, mode, algo, crop, userfeedback, cluster_step, cluster_resizewidth, cluster_color, opencv)
    110 
    111         # Check for variable correctness
--> 112         if start>1 or stop>1 or start<0 or stop<0 or start>=stop:
    113             raise Exception("Erroneous start or stop values. Please correct it in the config file.")
    114         if numframes2pick<1 and not int(numframes2pick):

TypeError: '>' not supported between instances of 'str' and 'int'
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Replace `yaml.load(cfg)` in **frame_extraction.py ** with `yaml.load(ymlfile, Loader=)` with `Loader` is specified using one of the Loaders in the above link. 
2. Add `print(dir(cfg))` in just after `print("Config file read successfully.")` to check the output of the `cfg` dictionary. 
3. Run `deeplabcut.extract_frames` using the `config.yaml` file created using `deeplabcut.create_new_project`
4. This produces the errors above (with some changes in the outputted dictionary due to the different loaders) 

Any advice will be greatly appreciated.
